docs.lead_paragraph: " Ginx's Baby" had once a success, and precisely why, save from the strange title, no one can tell. Mr. Edward Jenkins has written another book, called "Pantalas, and What They Did with Him," and it is published by Bentley. It has to do with human suffering and the inadequate means of relief. Pantalas is a human monstrosity, one-eyed, one-legged, one-armed, and represents the "submerged tenth." The Salvation Army is introduced into the story.
